bullets.text: Markets await Fed meeting; a likely rate cut and potential balance-sheet decisions could decide year-end rally momentum.
Bessent sees ~3% U.S. GDP growth and a very strong holiday season; divested soybean holdings after ethics warning.
U.S. tariffs and policy shifts have accelerated supply-chain moves out of China, reaching a tipping point for non‑China manufacturing.
Netflix’s bid for Warner Bros./HBO Max would reshape media economics; Trump administration signals heavy skepticism, raising regulatory risk.
Microsoft’s capex-to-sales hits 25%, surpassing Exxon; AI infrastructure spending continues to dominate corporate investment.
Record‑low U.S. cattle herd is driving beef prices to highs; rebuilding supplies will take years, prolonging food inflation pressures.
Coinbase resumes onboarding in India, plans fiat on‑ramp next year, signaling tentative regulatory thaw in a major crypto market.
Supreme Court reviews presidential authority over independent agencies, potentially overturning Humphrey’s Executor and reshaping U.S. regulatory power.
Benin says a coup attempt against President Talon was foiled, underscoring continued instability risks in West Africa.
Australia to ban social media for under‑16s, testing enforcement and setting a regulatory precedent for platforms worldwide.
X deactivated the European Commission’s ad account after a €120M fine, heightening platform‑regulator tensions in Europe.
Doctors sustained a human using a genetically engineered pig liver, a major step for xenotransplantation and organ‑shortage solutions.
A new fat‑burning diabetes pill preserved muscle and appetite in trials, suggesting improved obesity and metabolic‑disease treatments.
